content: large st patrick s day chart designed by michelle ryan copyright © 2006 by michelle ryan & nezumiworld all rights reserved general information and tips the size of the finished piece will depend on the yarn used and type of filet stitch grid you make a no 10 thread and a 1 x 1 filet grid 1 post stitch & 1 block or space will produce a much small square than using a worsted weight yarn and a 1 x 2 filet grid 1 post stitch & 2 blocks or spaces i have included the basic instructions for making a 1 x 1 filet grid and a 1 x 2 filet grid the sizing information is for a 1 x 2 filet grid use the hook required for the size of yarn/ thread chosen remember you could also use the graphs for tapestry crochet beaded crochet tunisian filet crochet embroidery even knitting go to nezumiworld com/crochet_101 htm for more details basic information 1 x 2 filet grid starting at bottom of pattern chart chain 382 chain 3 to turn which will count as first usa double_crochet/ uk treble_crochet of first row chain 2 more and usa double_crochet/ uk treble_crochet in 9th chain from hook to complete bottom right open square of pattern continue following pattern for the first row reading the graph right to left after completing first row chain 3 to turn to start next row continue following graph until all row are complete at end of row 67 fasten_off 1 x 1 filet grid starting at bottom of pattern chart chain 255 chain 3 to turn which will count as first usa double_crochet/ uk treble_crochet of first row chain 2 more and usa double_crochet/ uk treble_crochet in 9th chain from hook to complete bottom right open square of pattern continue following pattern for the first row reading the graph right to left after completing first row chain 3 to turn to start next row continue following graph until all row are complete at end of row 67 fasten_off page 2 materials estimated amounts based on crochet cotton and item made using a 1 x 2 filet grid please use as a guide only using crochet cotton no 5 about 1089 yds/ 991 metres steel crochet hook us size 4/ uk 1 75mm or size for gauge using crochet cotton no 10 about 970 yds/ 883 metres steel crochet hook us size 7/ uk 1 5mm or size for gauge using crochet cotton no 20 about 910 yds/ 829 metres steel crochet hook us size 9/ uk 1 25mm or size for gauge using crochet cotton no 30 about 851 yds/ 774 metres steel crochet hook us size 11/ uk 0 75mm or size for gauge using fingering/baby weight uk 4 ply/ sock weight about 2127 yds/ 1936 metres steel crochet hook us size f/ uk 3 75mm or size for gauge using sport weight uk double knit about 2468 yds/ 2246 metres steel crochet hook us size g/
